TI: [The contrary effect of destruction of the dorsal hippocampus and of the suprachiasmatic nucleus of the hypothalamus on the rhythmic organization of behavior and on anxiety in rats].
AB: Dorsal hippocampal lesions increase the amplitude of the circadian rhythms of locomotion and the number of long-period cycles in the structure of forced swimming and simultaneously decrease anxiety in rats. Bilateral destruction of the circadian pacemaker (suprachiasmatic nuclei of hypothalamus) induces the opposite shifts in the rhythmic organization of behavior and anxiety of animals.
TT: Protivopolozhnoe vliianie razrusheniia dorzal'nogo gippokampa i suprakhiazmaticheskikh iader gipotalamusa na ritmicheskuiu organizatsiiu povedeniia i trevozhnost' krys.
TA: Zh Vyssh Nerv Deiat Im I P Pavlova
JT: Zhurnal vysshei nervnoi deiatelnosti imeni I P Pavlova
SO: Zh Vyssh Nerv Deiat Im I P Pavlova. 1999 Mar-Apr;49(2):264-70.
